docs.summary: Manage services

permissions.name: Manage Bookings
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change the site's bookings, schedules, sessions, services and resources, including site owner data, staff member data, and participant data.

params.name: service
params.doc: The service to be created.

params.name: schedules
params.doc: List of schedules to be assigned for that service. Currently only a single schedule is allowed.

docs.summary: Creates a service

examples.title: Create Appointment Service

extra.description: Create a 1-1 appointment service

examples.title: Create a class service

extra.description: Create a Yoga class service taking place every Monday and Wednesday.

examples.title: Create a course service

extra.description: Create a Course (multiple sessions) service taking place on Monday, Wednesday and Friday from March 22nd to April 23rd.

permissions.name: Manage Bookings

params.name: id
params.doc: The Id of the service to delete

params.name: preserveFutureSessionsWithParticipants
params.doc: Whether to preserve future sessions with participants. Optional, default is false.

params.name: notifyParticipants
params.doc: Whether to notify participants about cancelled sessions due to a service being deleted. Optional, default is false. deprecated, use participant_notification

params.name: participantNotification
params.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

docs.summary: Deletes a service

extra.description: Delete a service by its Id. Future sessions and related bookings will be deleted as well.

permissions.name: Manage Bookings
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change the site's bookings, schedules, sessions, services and resources, including site owner data, staff member data, and participant data.

params.name: id
params.doc: Category ID.

params.name: deleteServices
params.doc: Cascade delete all the services in this category. Defaults to false (when false, the services will still exist but will not be accessible in the dashboard).

docs.summary:
Deletes a category.
 When deleting a category, you have the option to delete all the associated services within this category using the `deleteServices` field in the request.

extra.description: Delete a category by ID

permissions.name: Manage Bookings
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change the site's bookings, schedules, sessions, services and resources, including site owner data, staff member data, and participant data.

params.name: service
params.doc: The service entity to update.

params.name: scheduleActions
params.doc: Actions to perform on the service's schedules. Can contain schedules to create, update, and cancel.

params.name: participantNotification
params.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

params.name: schedules
params.doc: List of schedules to be updated for that service. These schedules should be an updated schedules of schedules which already associated to this service. Either the 'schedules' or 'schedule_actions' should be specified but not both.

params.name: notifyParticipants
params.doc: Whether to notify participants about changed sessions. deprecated, use participant_notification

docs.summary: Categories are used to group multiple services together. A service must be associated with a category in order to be exposed in the Wix Bookings UI.

members.name: id
members.doc: Category ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Category name.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Category status.
 Supported values:
  - "CREATED". The category is created.
  - "DELETED". The category is deleted.
 Default: "CREATED"

members.name: sortOrder
members.doc: Sort order of the category in the Dashboard.

docs.summary: An event sent every time a category entity is changed.

members.name: paths
members.doc: The set of field mask paths.

members.name: categories
members.doc: List of categories to be updated.

members.name: fieldMask
members.doc: Field mask of fields to update.

members.name: id
members.doc: Category ID.

members.name: deleteServices
members.doc: Cascade delete all the services in this category. Defaults to false (when false, the services will still exist but will not be accessible in the dashboard).

members.name: id
members.doc: Deleted Category ID.

members.name: category
members.doc: The updated category.

members.name: ids
members.doc: Category ID.

members.name: categories
members.doc: Category information.

members.name: categories
members.doc: Category information.

members.name: category
members.doc: Category information.

members.name: category
members.doc: Category information.

members.name: categoryIds
members.doc: Category IDs.

members.name: includeDeleted
members.doc: Whether to include deleted categories in the list. Defaults to false.

members.name: categories
members.doc: Category information.

docs.summary: A form can be defined by the site owner (Wix provides a default form), that defines and collects the customer's information as provided when booking a service.

members.name: id
members.doc: Form ID.

members.name: header
members.doc: Form header

members.name: actionLabels
members.doc: Available payment actions.

members.name: name
members.doc: Deprecated. Please use `first_name` and set `name` to an empty value. Either `name` or `first_name` must be provided, if a value exists for `name` it will be copied to `first_name` otherwise, the value of `first_name` will be copied to `name`. When using `first_name`, `name` must always be set to an empty value.

members.name: firstName
members.doc: Either `name` or `first_name` must be provided, if a value exists for `name` it will be copied to `first_name` otherwise, the value of `first_name` will be copied to `name`. When using `first_name`, `name` must always be set to an empty value.

members.name: lastName
members.doc: Customer's last name.

members.name: email
members.doc: Customer's email address.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Customer's phone number.

members.name: numberOfParticipants
members.doc: Number of participants being booked to the service (displayed in Wix Bookings UI only for services that allow booking multiple people per booking).

members.name: address
members.doc: Customer's address (displayed in Wix Bookings UI only when a services location is set to "Customers Place").

members.name: customFields
members.doc: Custom fields which can be added to the form.

docs.summary: A booking form usually includes an action (e.g. Book) once all input is entered. The possible labels can be configured by this object.

members.name: offlinePaymentLabel
members.doc: Call to Action (CTA) text to display in Wix Bookings UI for in-person payment.

members.name: onlinePaymentLabel
members.doc: Call to Action (CTA) text to display in Wix Bookings UI for online payment.

members.name: bookingRequestApprovalLabel
members.doc: Call to Action (CTA) text to display in Wix Bookings UI for requesting booking approval.

docs.summary: The header of the form

members.name: description
members.doc: Form description (displayed below the header in Wix Bookings UI).

members.name: title
members.doc: Form title.

members.name: isDescriptionHidden
members.doc: Whether the form description should be displayed in the Wix Bookings UI.

docs.summary: Description of the address form input

members.name: required
members.doc: Whether customer's input in this field is required.

docs.summary: Holds form field information and configuration

members.name: fieldId
members.doc: Field ID.

members.name: label
members.doc: Field label.

members.name: userConstraints
members.doc: Constraints applied to this field.

members.name: additionalLabels
members.doc: Additional labels applied to this field.

members.name: label
members.doc: Additional label applied to this text-only field.

members.name: label
members.doc: Additional label applied to this URL-only field.

members.name: url
members.doc: Returned URL.

docs.summary: An event sent each time the form entity is updated.

members.name: id
members.doc: Id of the form to be deleted.

members.name: id
members.doc: Id of the form which was deleted, if successful

members.name: form
members.doc: The updated form. Must include the form Id

members.name: form
members.doc: The updated form

members.name: form
members.doc: The form to be created

members.name: form
members.doc: The created form

members.name: id
members.doc: The Id of the form to get

members.name: form
members.doc: The requested form

members.name: forms
members.doc: The requested form

members.name: id
members.doc: WixMedia image ID.

members.name: url
members.doc: Image URL.

members.name: height
members.doc: Original image height.

members.name: width
members.doc: Original image width.

members.name: altText
members.doc: Image alt text.

members.name: filename
members.doc: Image filename.

members.name: type
members.doc:
SEO tag type. 


 Supported values: `title`, `meta`, `script`, `link`.

members.name: props
members.doc:
A `{'key':'value'}` pair object where each SEO tag property (`'name'`, `'content'`, `'rel'`, `'href'`) contains a value.
 For example: `{'name': 'description', 'content': 'the description itself'}`.

members.name: meta
members.doc: SEO tag meta data. For example, `{height: 300, width: 240}`.

members.name: children
members.doc: SEO tag inner content. For example, `<title> inner content </title>`.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether the tag is a custom tag.

members.name: disabled
members.doc: Whether the tag is disabled.

members.name: preventAutoRedirect
members.doc:
Whether the Auto Redirect feature, which creates `301 redirects` on a slug change, is enabled. 


 Default: `false` (Auto Redirect is enabled.)

members.name: keywords
members.doc: User-selected keyword terms for a specific page.

members.name: term
members.doc: Keyword value.

members.name: isMain
members.doc: Whether the keyword is the main focus keyword.

docs.summary:
The SEO schema object contains data about different types of meta tags. It makes sure that the information about your page is presented properly to search engines.
 The search engines use this information for ranking purposes, or to display snippets in the search results.
 This data will override other sources of tags (for example patterns) and will be included in the <head> section of the HTML document, while not being displayed on the page itself.

members.name: tags
members.doc: SEO tag information.

members.name: settings
members.doc: SEO general settings.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc:
Whether to send the message about the changes to the customer.

Default: `false`

members.name: message
members.doc: Custom message to send to the participants about the changes to the booking.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs.Set of custom properties for the service.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

docs.summary: A service describes the business offering that a business provides to its customers.

members.name: id
members.doc: Service ID.

members.name: info
members.doc: Information about the service.

members.name: policy
members.doc: Description of the bookings policy for the service.

members.name: paymentOptions
members.doc: Payment options available for use when booking the service.

members.name: categoryId
members.doc: ID of the category to which the service belongs.

members.name: bookingFormId
members.doc: ID of the form that visitors fill out when booking the service.

members.name: scheduleIds
members.doc:
List of schedule IDs for the sessions and slots that can be booked for the service.
 The list can include schedules with any `status` values, however the Bookings application only uses the schedules with a `status` of `"CREATED"`. There is only one schedule with a status of `"CREATED"` per service. The ID of that schedule must always be the first in the list.

members.name: customProperties
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs.Set of custom properties for the service.

members.name: status
members.doc: Service status.

members.name: sortOrder
members.doc: Sort order of the service within its category.

members.name: advancedSeoData
members.doc: Advanced SEO data

members.name: seoData
members.doc: SEO data

members.name: includeConferenceOption
members.doc: Whether a conference is to be generated for the service.

docs.summary: Information describing the service.

members.name: name
members.doc: Service name.

members.name: description
members.doc: Service description.

members.name: images
members.doc: Images associated with the service. Deprecated.

members.name: tagLine
members.doc: Short service description.

members.name: media
members.doc: Images associated with the service. Optional. Not supported yet.

members.name: items
members.doc: Images associated with the service.

members.name: mainMedia
members.doc: Primary image associated with the service.

members.name: coverMedia
members.doc: Cover image associated with the service.

members.name: image
members.doc: Image metadata.

docs.summary: A set of rules defining the policies for booking the service for visitors and members.

members.name: maxParticipantsPerBooking
members.doc: Maximum number of participants for a single booking. Defaults to 1.

members.name: bookUpToXMinutesBefore
members.doc: Minimum number of minutes before the start of a session that a booking can be made. For a schedule, this is relative to the start time of the next session, excluding past sessions. Default value is taken form BusinessServicesPolicy.

members.name: cancelRescheduleUpToXMinutesBefore
members.doc: Minimum number of minutes before the start of a session that a booking can be canceled or rescheduled. Default value is taken form BusinessServicesPolicy.

members.name: isBookOnlineAllowed
members.doc: Whether online booking is available. Defaults to true.

members.name: isCancelAllowed
members.doc: Whether bookings for the service can be canceled. Defaults to true.

members.name: isRescheduleAllowed
members.doc: Whether bookings for the service can be rescheduled. Defaults to true.

members.name: futureBookingsPolicy
members.doc: How far in advance a booking can be made. Default value is taken form BusinessServicesPolicy.

members.name: waitingListPolicy
members.doc: Waitlist policy for the service. Default value is taken form BusinessServicesPolicy.

members.name: bookingsApprovalPolicy
members.doc: Bookings approval policy for the service. Empty by default.

members.name: overrideBusinessPolicyFields
members.doc:
A list of booking policy field names of fields that override the respective values of the default business booking policy.
 Currently only 'service.policy.bookUpToXMinutesBefore' field is supported

members.name: cancellationPolicy
members.doc: User defined cancellation policy message.

members.name: shouldLimit
members.doc: Whether a limit is imposed on advance bookings.

members.name: limitXMinutesToTheFuture
members.doc: How far in advance, in minutes, a session can be booked. Defaults to 10,080 minutes (3 days).

members.name: isEnabled
members.doc: Whether waitlisting is enabled for the service.

members.name: capacity
members.doc: Number of spots available in the waitlist. Defaults to 10 spots.

members.name: timeWindowMinutes
members.doc: Amount of time a participant is given to book, once notified that a spot is available. Defaults to 10 minutes.

members.name: isBusinessApprovalRequired
members.doc: Whether bookings to the service require approval.

members.name: requestsAffectsAvailability
members.doc: Whether the booking requests affect the session or slot availability. For example, 3 booking requests for a 10-person session will cause the session to have 7 available spots, before the requests are approved.

docs.summary:
Payment options for the service. Multiple payment options can be enabled. For example:
For a service to be paid only online using WiX, then set wix_pay_online=true and the rest should be set to false.
For a service to accept payment online via Wix or in person, set the wix_pay_online=true & wix_pay_in_person=true.

members.name: wixPayOnline
members.doc: Whether a booking made for the service can be paid online through Wix.

members.name: wixPayInPerson
members.doc: Whether a booking made for the service can be paid in person.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether a booking made for the service can be paid in a customized way, defined by the API.

members.name: wixPaidPlan
members.doc: Whether a booking made for the service can be paid using Wix Pricing Plans.

docs.summary:
Defines the Bookings Policy applied to the business's services. The policy can be overridden for a service when setting the `Service.BookingsPolicy` property.
Unless overridden, each service inherits the settings in the business policy.

members.name: bookUpToXMinutesBefore
members.doc: Minimum amount of time to make a booking before the start of the booked item. For sessions, this is relative to the start time of the session. For schedules, this is relative to the start time of the first session, excluding past sessions. Defaults to 0.

members.name: cancelRescheduleUpToXMinutesBefore
members.doc: Minimum time that a booking can be canceled or rescheduled before the session starts. Defaults to 0.

members.name: futureBookingsPolicy
members.doc: An object specifying how far in advance a booking can be made.

members.name: waitingListPolicy
members.doc: Waitlist policy for the service. Empty by default.

members.name: cancellationPolicy
members.doc: User defined cancellation policy message.

members.name: service
members.doc: Updated service entity.

members.name: policy
members.doc: Service policy.

members.name: policy
members.doc: Service policy.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Required payment amount.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency in which the amount is quoted.

members.name: downPayAmount
members.doc: Amount of a down payment or deposit as part of the transaction.

messages.name: labeledPriceOptionsMapEntry
messages.displayName: labeled Price Options Map Entry Object

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs. Mapping between a named price option, for example, adult or child prices, and the price, currency, and down payment amount.
 When present in an update request, the `default_varied_price` is ignored to support backward compatibility.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: labeledPriceOptions
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs. Mapping between a named price option, for example, adult or child prices, and the price, currency, and down payment amount.
 When present in an update request, the `default_varied_price` is ignored to support backward compatibility.

members.name: priceText
members.doc:
Textual price information used when **Price Per Session** is set to **Custom Price** in the app's service details page.
 When present in an update request, the `default_varied_price` is ignored to support backward compatibility.

docs.summary: Business schedule. Regular and exceptional time periods when the business is open or the service is available.

members.name: periods
members.doc: Weekly recurring time periods when the business is regularly open or the service is available. Limited to 100 time periods.

members.name: specialHourPeriod
members.doc: Exceptions to the business's regular hours. The business can be open or closed during the exception.

docs.summary: Weekly recurring time periods when the business is regularly open or the service is available.

members.name: openDay
members.doc: Day of the week the period starts on.

members.name: openTime
members.doc:
Time the period starts in 24-hour [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) extended format. Valid values are `00:00` to `24:00`, where `24:00` represents
midnight at the end of the specified day.

members.name: closeDay
members.doc: Day of the week the period ends on.

members.name: closeTime
members.doc:
Time the period ends in 24-hour [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) extended format. Valid values are `00:00` to `24:00`, where `24:00` represents
midnight at the end of the specified day.  

__Note:__ If `openDay` and `closeDay` specify the same day of the week `closeTime` must be later than `openTime`.

docs.summary: Exception to the business's regular hours. The business can be open or closed during the exception.

members.name: startDate
members.doc: Start date and time of the exception in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format and [Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time).

members.name: endDate
members.doc: End date and time of the exception in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format and [Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time).

members.name: isClosed
members.doc:
Whether the business is closed (or the service is not available) during the exception. 

Default: `true`.

members.name: comment
members.doc: Additional info about the exception. For example, "We close earlier on New Year's Eve."

members.name: id
members.doc: Location ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Location name.

members.name: description
members.doc: Location description.

members.name: default
members.doc: Whether this is the default location. There can only be one default location per site. The default location can't be archived.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Location status. Defaults to `ACTIVE`. 
__Note:__ [Archiving a location](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/business-info/locations/archive-location) 
doesn't affect the location's status. `INACTIVE` is currently not supported.

members.name: locationType
members.doc:
Location type. 

**Note:** Currently not supported.

members.name: fax
members.doc: Fax number.

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: Timezone in `America/New_York` format.

members.name: email
members.doc: Email address.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Phone number.

members.name: address
members.doc: Address.

members.name: businessSchedule
members.doc:
Business schedule. Array of weekly recurring time periods when the location is open for business. Limited to 100 time periods.

__Note:__ Not supported by Wix Bookings.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the location is updated. 
To prevent conflicting changes, the existing revision must be used when updating a location.

members.name: archived
members.doc:
Whether the location is archived. Archived locations can't be updated. 
__Note:__ [Archiving a location](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/business-info/locations/archive-location) 
doesn't affect its `status`.

members.name: locationTypes
members.doc: Location types.

members.name: country
members.doc: 2-letter country code in an [ISO-3166 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) format.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Code for a subdivision (such as state, prefecture, or province) in [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) format.

members.name: city
members.doc: City name.

members.name: postalCode
members.doc: Postal or zip code.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street address. Includes street name, number, and apartment number in separate fields.

members.name: formattedAddress
members.doc: Full address of the location.

members.name: hint
members.doc: Extra information that helps finding the location.

members.name: geocode
members.doc: Geographic coordinates of location.

docs.summary: Street address. Includes street name, number, and apartment number in separate fields.

members.name: number
members.doc: Street number.

members.name: name
members.doc: Street name.

members.name: apt
members.doc: Apartment number.

docs.summary: Address Geolocation

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Latitude of the location. Must be between -90 and 90.

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Longitude of the location. Must be between -180 and 180.

members.name: country
members.doc: Country code.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Subdivision. Usually state, region, prefecture or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: city
members.doc: City name.

members.name: postalCode
members.doc: Zip/postal code.

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc: Free text providing more detailed address info. Usually contains Apt, Suite, and Floor.

members.name: formattedAddress
members.doc: A string containing the full address of this location.

members.name: hint
members.doc: Free text to help find the address.

members.name: geocode
members.doc: Coordinates of the physical address.

members.name: countryFullname
members.doc: Country full name.

members.name: subdivisions
members.doc: Multi-level subdivisions from top to bottom.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street name, number and apartment number.

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line, usually street and number, as free text.

members.name: code
members.doc: Subdivision code. Usually state, region, prefecture or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: name
members.doc: Subdivision full name.

members.name: number
members.doc: Street number.

members.name: name
members.doc: Street name.

members.name: apt
members.doc: Apartment number.

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Address latitude.

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Address longitude.

members.name: locationType
members.doc:
Location type.
 One of:
 - `"OWNER_BUSINESS"` The business address as set in the sites general settings.
 - `"OWNER_CUSTOM"` The address as set when creating the service.
 - `"CUSTOM"` The address set for the individual session.

members.name: address
members.doc: Free text address used when locationType is `OWNER_CUSTOM`.

members.name: customAddress
members.doc: Custom address, used when locationType is `"OWNER_CUSTOM"`. Might be used when locationType is `"CUSTOM"` in case the owner sets a custom address for the session which is different from the default.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: transparency
members.doc:
Sets this schedule's availability for the duration of the linked schedule's sessions.  Default is `"BUSY"`.
<!--ONLY:REST-->
 If set to `"BUSY"`, this schedule cannot have any available slots during the linked schedule's sessions. 
 If set to `"FREE"`, this schedule can have available slots during the linked schedule's sessions.  
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO
 One of:
 - `"FREE"` This schedule can have available slots during the linked schedule's sessions.
 - `"BUSY"` This schedule cannot have any available slots during the linked schedule's sessions.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: Owner ID, of the linked schedule.

docs.summary: The time between available slots' start times. For example, For 5 minute slots, 3:00, 3:05, 3:15 etc. For 1 hour slots, 3:00, 4:00, 5:00 etc.

members.name: sameAsDuration
members.doc:
Whether the slot duration is used as the split interval value.
If `same_as_duration` is `true`, the `value_in_minutes` is the sum of the first duration in
`schedule.availabilityConstraints.SlotDurations` field, and `schedule.availabilityConstraints.TimeBetweenSlots` field.

members.name: valueInMinutes
members.doc: Number of minutes between available slots' start times when `same_as_duration` is `false`.

docs.summary:
<!-- Needs updating when recurrence has been tested 
Schedule's availability calculation is executed by the schedule's available intervals and this additional information.
Schedule's available intervals are recurring intervals (defined in the schedule) minus sessions that has no more spots for bookings (including time between_slots), or schedule's sessions with open spots for bookings.-->

members.name: start
members.doc: Date and time the schedule starts to be available for booking.

members.name: end
members.doc: Date and time the schedule stops being available for booking. No value indicates no end time.

members.name: linkedSchedules
members.doc: Other schedules that impact the availability calculation. Relevant only when there are availability constraints.

members.name: constraints
members.doc: Constraints for calculating the schedule's availability.

docs.summary: Describes how to calculate the specific slots that are available for booking.

members.name: slotDurations
members.doc:
A list of duration options for slots, in minutes. Minimum value for a duration is 1.
The availability calculation generates slots with these durations, where there is no conflict with existing sessions or other availability constraints.

members.name: timeBetweenSlots
members.doc:
The number of minutes between the `end` of one slot, and the `start` of the next. 
Minimum value is 0, maximum value is 120.

members.name: splitInterval
members.doc:
Specify how to split the slots in intervals of minutes.
This value indicates the time between available slots' start time. e.g., from 5 minute slots (3:00, 3:05, 3:15) and 1 hour slots (3:00, 4:00, 5:00).
Optional. The default is the first duration in slot_durations field.
Deprecated. Use the `split_slots_interval.value_in_minutes`.

members.name: slotsSplitInterval
members.doc: An object defining the time between available slots' start times.  For example, a slot with slots_split_interval=5 can start every 5 minutes. The default is the slot duration.

members.name: title
members.doc: Synced title of the external calendar event.

members.name: description
members.doc: Synced description of the external calendar event.

members.name: repetition
members.doc: The frequency of the recurrence in weeks. i.e. when this value is 4, the interval occurs every 4 weeks. Optional. The default is 1. minimum: 1, maximum: 52.

members.name: daysOfWeek
members.doc: The day the interval accrue. Optional. The default is the day of the recurring interval's start time.

members.name: hourOfDay
members.doc: The hour of the day the interval accrue. must be consistent with the Interval start time. Options. The default is 0. minimum: 0, maximum: 23.

members.name: minuteOfHour
members.doc: The minutes of hour the interval accrue. must be consistent with the Interval end time. Options. The default is 0. minimum: 0, maximum: 59.

members.name: duration
members.doc: The duration of the interval in minutes. Required. Part of the session end time calculation.

members.name: id
members.doc: The recurring interval identifier.

members.name: start
members.doc: The start time of the recurring interval. Required.

members.name: end
members.doc: The end time of the recurring interval. Optional. Empty value indicates that there is no end time.

members.name: interval
members.doc: The interval rules. The day, hour and minutes the interval is recurring.

members.name: frequency
members.doc: The frequency of the interval. Optional. The default is frequency with the default repetition.

members.name: affectedSchedules
members.doc: Specifies the list of linked schedules and the way this link affects the corresponding schedules' availability. Can be calculated from the schedule or overridden on the recurring interval.

members.name: intervalType
members.doc:
The type of recurring interval.
<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:
 - `"UNDEFINED"` The default value. Sessions for this interval will be of type EVENT.
 - `"EVENT"` A recurring interval of events.
 - `"WORKING_HOURS"` A recurring interval for availability.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: id
members.doc: Participant ID. Currently represents the booking.id.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Participant's name.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Participant's phone number.

members.name: email
members.doc: Participant's email address.

members.name: partySize
members.doc: Group or party size. The number of people attending. Defaults to 0. Maximum is 250.

members.name: approvalStatus
members.doc:
Approval status for the participant. 
<!-- Commented out untill updateParticipant is exposed Generally the same status as the booking, unless updated using the `updateParticipant()` API. Defaults to `"UNDEFINED"`.-->
<!--ONLY:VELO
 One of:
 - `"PENDING"` Pending business approval.
 - `"APPROVED"` Approved by the business.
 - `"DECLINED"` Declined by the business. 
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: inherited
members.doc: Whether the participant was inherited from the schedule, as opposed to being booked directly to the session.

members.name: providerId
members.doc: Conferencing provider ID

members.name: id
members.doc: Wix Calendar conference ID.

members.name: externalId
members.doc: Conference meeting ID in the provider's conferencing system.

members.name: providerId
members.doc: Conference provider ID.

members.name: hostUrl
members.doc: URL used by the host to start the conference.

members.name: guestUrl
members.doc: URL used by a guest to join the conference.

members.name: password
members.doc: Password to join the conference.

members.name: description
members.doc: Conference description.

members.name: conferenceType
members.doc:
Conference type.
<!--ONLY:VELO
 One of:
 - `"ONLINE_MEETING_PROVIDER"` API-generated online meeting.
 - `"CUSTOM"` User-defined meeting.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: accountOwnerId
members.doc: ID of the account owner in the video conferencing service.

members.name: scheduleVersion
members.doc: Schedule version number, updated each time the schedule is updated.

members.name: participantsVersion
members.doc: Participants version number, updated each time the schedule participants are updated.

members.name: id
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: ID of the schedule's owner entity. This may be a resource ID or a service ID.

members.name: timeZone
members.doc:
Schedule's time zone in [Area/Location](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tz_database) format. Read-only.
 Derived from the Wix Business time zone.

members.name: intervals
members.doc: Deprecated. Please use the [Sessions API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/schedules-and-sessions/session) instead.

members.name: title
members.doc: Default title for the schedule's sessions. Maximum length: 6000 characters.

members.name: tags
members.doc:
__Deprecated.__ 
Tags for grouping schedules. These tags are the default tags for the schedule's sessions.
The Wix Bookings app uses the following predefined tags to set schedule type: `"INDIVIDUAL"`, `"GROUP"`, and `"COURSE"`. Once the schedule type is set using these tags, you cannot update it. In addition to the app's tags, you can create and update your own tags.

members.name: location
members.doc: Default location for the schedule's sessions.

members.name: capacity
members.doc:
Maximum number of participants that can be added to the schedule's sessions.
Must be at most `1` for schedule whose availability is affected by another schedule. E.g, appointment schedules of the Wix Bookings app.

members.name: rate
members.doc: Deprecated. Please use the [Booking Services V2](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/services-v2) payment instead.

members.name: availability
members.doc: __Deprecated.__

members.name: totalNumberOfParticipants
members.doc: Number of participants registered to sessions in this schedule, calculated as the sum of the party sizes.

members.name: participants
members.doc:
**Partial list** of participants which are registered to sessions in this schedule.  
 Participants who are registered in the schedule are automatically registered to any session that is created for the schedule.    
 To retrieve the full list of schedule participants please use the [Query Extended Bookings API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/bookings-reader-v2/query-extended-bookings).

members.name: externalCalendarOverrides
members.doc: __Deprecated.__

members.name: status
members.doc: Schedule status.

members.name: created
members.doc: Schedule creation date.

members.name: updated
members.doc: Schedule last update date.

members.name: version
members.doc: Schedule version number, updated each time the schedule is updated.

members.name: inheritedFields
members.doc: Fields which were inherited from the Business Info page under Settings in the Dashboard.

members.name: conferenceProvider
members.doc: __Deprecated.__

members.name: calendarConference
members.doc:
A conference created for the schedule. This is used when a participant is added to a schedule.    
 **Partially deprecated.** Only `hostUrl` and `guestUrl` are to be supported.

docs.summary: schedule

members.name: schedule
members.doc: Schedule.

members.name: schedule
members.doc: Schedule.

members.name: fieldMask
members.doc: Field mask of fields to update.

members.name: alignTimeExceptions
members.doc: Optional. Defaults to false. In case of updated intervals' start time, this field indicates whether to align those interval's time exceptions.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc: Deprecated, use participant_notification.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change, and an optional custom message.

members.name: createRequests
members.doc: Create multiple schedules.

members.name: updateRequests
members.doc: Update multiple schedules. Not Supported yet.

members.name: cancelRequests
members.doc:
Cancel multiple schedules.
The given schedules move to a CANCELLED status which means that all sessions up until
the cancellation point in time are kept, while removing all following sessions.

members.name: created
members.doc: Created schedules.

members.name: updated
members.doc: Updated schedules.

members.name: cancelled
members.doc: Cancelled schedules.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: from
members.doc: Time to cancel the sessions from. Optional. If this field is empty, all of this schedule's sessions will be canceled.

members.name: preserveFutureSessionsWithParticipants
members.doc: Whether to preserve future sessions with reservations. Defaults to false.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc: Deprecated, use participant_notification

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change, and an optional custom message.

docs.summary: Updated a set of services

members.name: services
members.doc: The list of services with the updated information. Each service must contain the Id of the service to update.

members.name: fieldMask
members.doc: A field mask of fields to update

members.name: ids
members.doc: The Id of the service to delete

docs.summary: Delete s service

members.name: id
members.doc: The Id of the service to delete

members.name: preserveFutureSessionsWithParticipants
members.doc: Whether to preserve future sessions with participants. Optional, default is false.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about cancelled sessions due to a service being deleted. Optional, default is false. deprecated, use participant_notification

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: id
members.doc: The Id of the deleted service

members.name: service
members.doc: The service to be created.

members.name: schedules
members.doc: List of schedules to be assigned for that service. Currently only a single schedule is allowed.

members.name: id
members.doc: DEPRECATED. The Id of the created service.

members.name: service
members.doc: The created service.

members.name: ids
members.doc: The Id of the created service.

members.name: service
members.doc: The service entity to update.

members.name: scheduleActions
members.doc: Actions to perform on the service's schedules. Can contain schedules to create, update, and cancel.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: schedules
members.doc: List of schedules to be updated for that service. These schedules should be an updated schedules of schedules which already associated to this service. Either the 'schedules' or 'schedule_actions' should be specified but not both.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about changed sessions. deprecated, use participant_notification

members.name: service
members.doc: The updated service.

members.name: schedules
members.doc: Updated schedules.

members.name: id
members.doc: Requested service Id

members.name: service
members.doc: Requested service

members.name: includeDeleted
members.doc: Optional. Default is false

members.name: services
members.doc: List of all retrieved services

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • CREATED - Default status.
  • DELETED - Category is deleted.

Possible values are:
  • Updated
  • Deleted
  • Created

Possible values are:
  • SHORT_TEXT - Short text. This is the default value type.
  • LONG_TEXT - Long text
  • CHECK_BOX - a text that represent the check box value: if selected the value is "true", otherwise "false".

Possible values are:
  • Updated
  • Deleted
  • Created

Possible values are:
  • CREATED - The default service status.
  • DELETED - The service is deleted.

Possible values are:
  • Unspecified
  • Updated
  • Deleted
  • Created

Enumerates the days of the week. Possible values are:
  • MONDAY
  • TUESDAY
  • WEDNESDAY
  • THURSDAY
  • FRIDAY
  • SATURDAY
  • SUNDAY

For future use Possible values are:
  • ACTIVE
  • INACTIVE

For future use Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • BRANCH
  • OFFICES
  • RECEPTION
  • HEADQUARTERS
  • INVENTORY

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • OWNER_BUSINESS
  • OWNER_CUSTOM
  • CUSTOM

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • FREE - The schedule can have available slots during the session.
  • BUSY - The schedule cannot have available slots during the session. Default value.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED - Undefined.
  • MON - Monday.
  • TUE - Tuesday.
  • WED - Wednesday.
  • THU - Thursday.
  • FRI - Friday.
  • SAT - Saturday.
  • SUN - Sunday.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED - The default value. Sessions for this interval will be of type EVENT.
  • EVENT - A recurring interval of events
  • TIME_AVAILABILITY - Deprecated
  • AVAILABILITY - A recurring interval for availability

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED - Default.
  • PENDING - Pending business approval.
  • APPROVED - Approved by the business.
  • DECLINED - Declined by the business.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • ONLINE_MEETING_PROVIDER - API-generated online meeting.
  • CUSTOM - User-defined meeting.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • CREATED - The default value when the schedule is created.
  • CANCELLED - The schedule has been canceled.
